newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: MCRETAIL IN AUTOCATALYST DEAL WITH PEUGEOT.
newsitem.headline: MCRETAIL IN AUTOCATALYST DEAL WITH PEUGEOT.

text.p: South Africa's McCarthy Retail Ltd (McRetail) said on Thursday its McCarthy Motor Holdings unit had signed an export deal for catalytic convertors with French car giant Peugeot .
The deal, worth an undisclosed sum, will see McCarthy export 200,000 manufactured catalytic convertors a year to Peugeot's car-making plants in France.
Consignments will be flown out of South Africa once a week to meet Peugeot's supply requirements, the firm said.
The convertors are to be made by Autocat Manufacturers at a new plant in Port Elizabeth on the country's southern coast.

McCarthy Motor chief executive, Brand Pretorious, said the deal was a major breakthrough for the firm. "It enables us to claim export rebates to offset import duties, with the savings then passed on to the consumer in the form of competitive prices," he said.
Bernard Marot, Peugeot director of international operations, said the deal was a vote of confidence in the firm's future in South Africa.
Marot said the move could herald other export opportunities for South African firms. "The possibility of importing other South African manufactured components is being investigated," the firm said.
